overview_of_class: We will sample historical literature on how nation, race, and tribe have been imagined in modern Africa.
name: General Field Seminar in African History
title: WCAS HISTORY 450-1-1 General Field Seminar in African History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: We will sample historical literature on how nation, race, and tribe have been imagined in modern Africa.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
James R. Brennan, Taifa: Making Nation and Race in Urban Tanzania
Jemima Pierre, The Predicament of Blackness: Postcolonial Ghana and the Politics of Race
Derek Peterson, Ethnic Patriotism and the East African Revival
Peter Geschiere, The Perils of Belonging: Autochthony, Citizenship, and Exclusion in Africa & Europe
Jan Vansina, Antecedents of Modern Rwanda
Scott Straus, The Order of Genocide
Carolyn Hamilton, Terrific Majesty: the Powers of Shaka Zulu and the Limits of Historical Imagination
Thembisa Waetjen, Workers and Warriors: Masculinity & the Struggle for Nation in South Africa
John Lonsdale, "The moral economy of Mau Mau," in Lonsdale and Berman, Unhappy Valley
Leroy Vail (ed.), The Creation of Tribalism in Southern Africa (excerpts)

subject: HISTORY
